courses.title: Computer Vision
courses.description: Image processing, object detection, and computer vision techniques

learningPaths.title: An Introduction to Vision
learningPaths.description: This chapter explores the fascinating world of human perception to understand its flaws and strengths. Through interactive illusions, we'll define the core challenge of computer vision: teaching a machine to see like us.

modules.title: The Selective Filter
modules.description: Learn why our vision isn't a camera but an evolutionary filter. We'll explore how we recognize objects and why we only perceive a tiny fraction of the world.

lessons.title: Lesson 1: The Human Vision Filter
Podcast: The Invisible World

modules.title: From Light to Meaning
modules.description: Discover the model of how our brain turns raw light into meaning. We'll differentiate between objective data and our subjective experience of the world.

lessons.title: Lesson 2: A Model of Perception: From Light to Meaning
Podcast: Is Your Red the Same as My Red?

modules.title: The Power of Context
modules.description: Explore how context rules our perception. Through classic illusions, we'll see how what surrounds an object can completely change how we perceive it.

lessons.title: Lesson 3: The Interpreting Brain: Context is Everything
Math Explainer: The Lightness Constancy Equation
Podcast: Your Brain the Storyteller

modules.title: Hands-On with Illusions
modules.description: Witness how the brain invents motion and color that aren't there. Then, step into the 'Illusion Playground' to experiment with these phenomena yourself.

lessons.title: Lesson 4: The Fallible Brain: Phantom Motion & Colors
Experiment: Hands-On: The Illusion Playground
Exercise: Perception Detective
Podcast: Ghosts in the Machine

modules.title: The Attentional Spotlight
modules.description: Discover the power and limits of attention. Through interactive demos, we'll explore 'change blindness' and why we often miss things happening right in front of us.

lessons.title: Lesson 5: The Attentive Brain: What You Don't See
Podcast: The Spotlight of a Mind

modules.title: The Core Challenge
modules.description: This capstone module connects human perception to machines. We'll define the core challenge of computer vision: bridging the gap between a meaningless pixel and true understanding.

lessons.title: Lesson 6: Human vs. Machine: The Core Challenge
Math Explainer: How a Computer REALLY Sees an Image
Real-World Example: Why You Can Read This, But a Robot Can't (The Story of CAPTCHA)
Podcast: Building the Bridge of Bytes

learningPaths.title: Perception Systems: From Human Vision to Digital Images
learningPaths.description: This chapter bridges the gap between biology and technology. We'll start by dissecting the human eye and brain to understand nature's masterpiece of vision. Then, we'll build a digital camera from the ground up, exploring the physics, hardware, and software that turn light into the digital images that power computer vision.

modules.title: The Nature of Light
modules.description: Explore the fundamental ingredient of all vision: light. We'll uncover its dual nature as both a wave and a particle, see where it fits in the vast electromagnetic spectrum, and understand how its interaction with objects creates the colors of our world.

lessons.title: Lesson 1: The Secret Ingredient - What is Light?
Podcast: Can You See Wi-Fi?

modules.title: The Biological Sensor
modules.description: Take a tour of the human eye, nature's original camera. We'll examine its key components and meet the specialized photoreceptor cells—Rods and Cones—that form the powerhouse duo for our day and night vision.

lessons.title: Lesson 2: The Human Sensor - How the Eye Works
Podcast: Built Backwards and Seeing Stars

modules.title: The Visual Brain
modules.description: Follow the neural signal from the retina into the brain's complex processing centers. Discover how we perceive millions of colors with only three types of cone cells and how the brain splits its visual processing into two fundamental streams: "What" and "Where."

lessons.title: Lesson 3: From Signal to Sight - Color and the Brain
Podcast: The What, The Where, and The Yellow

modules.title: The Artificial Eye
modules.description: Build a camera from first principles. We'll start with the elegant geometry of the pinhole camera, derive its core mathematical equations, and then see how lenses and apertures are used to control focus and create artistic effects like a blurry background.

lessons.title: Lesson 4: The Artificial Eye - Camera Basics
Manim Video: The Geometry of a Pinhole
Exercise: Pinhole Calculations

modules.title: The Digital Retina
modules.description: Dive into the heart of a modern camera: the image sensor. Learn how colorblind photodiodes are given color vision by a Bayer Filter and compare the two rival sensor technologies, CCD and CMOS, that have shaped the world of photography.

lessons.title: Lesson 5: Inside the Digital Camera - The Sensor
Podcast: The Bucket Brigade and the Color Puzzle

modules.title: The Dark Side of Speed
modules.description: Uncover the strange side effect of modern CMOS sensors. We'll explore the 'rolling shutter' phenomenon and see how it can warp reality, bending propellers and creating 'jello' effects in video, a critical concept for professionals in VFX and sports.

lessons.title: Lesson 6: The Dark Side of Speed - Rolling Shutter
Real-World Case Study: VFX vs. The Jello Effect
Podcast: Bent Propellers and Wobbly Videos

modules.title: An Image is Born
modules.description: Witness the final steps where raw sensor data becomes a recognizable image. We'll see how the camera's software fills in missing colors, applies finishing touches, and finally quantizes the image into the 3D grid of numbers that we will work with for the rest of this course.

lessons.title: Lesson 7: Making the Image - Pixels and Values
Coding Lesson: An Image is Just a NumPy Array
Podcast: It's All Just Numbers

learningPaths.title: Image Representation
learningPaths.description: This chapter deconstructs the digital image, revealing how the continuous, vibrant real world is translated into a structured grid of numbers. We will explore how space and color are quantized, discover the universal language of color science, and learn the fundamental analysis tools that form the bedrock of all computer vision.

modules.title: The Pixel Grid
modules.description: We begin by establishing the fundamental building block of all digital images: the pixel. You'll learn how the physical world is sampled onto a discrete grid and how this process defines an image's detail and sharpness.

lessons.title: Lesson 1: From the Real World to a Grid of Pixels
Podcast: Pixels, Minecraft, and Security Cameras
Experiment: Hands-On: The Resolution & Pixelation Lab

modules.title: Color, Quantization, and Data Structure
modules.description: Discover how continuous light is converted into discrete numbers. We'll explore the concept of bit depth, contrast the additive (screen) and subtractive (print) color models, and reveal the underlying numerical data structure of a color image.

lessons.title: Lesson 2: Giving Pixels Color - The Basics of Quantization
Podcast: Painting vs. Pixels
Math Explainer: The Power of Two: Understanding Bit Depth
Coding: Your First Look at an Image in Python

modules.title: Universal and Practical Color
modules.description: We tackle the problem of inconsistent color across devices by learning the universal language of color science. We'll explore the CIE standard, define the practical limits (gamuts) of our devices, and investigate how we can measure color differences in a way that aligns with human perception.

lessons.title: Lesson 3: A Universal Language for Color - The CIE Spaces
Podcast: Why Coca-Cola Red is Always Coca-Cola Red
Math Explainer: Normalizing Color: From 3D Space to a 2D Map
Exercise: Chromaticity Calculations
Lesson 4: Color in Practice - Gamuts and Perceptual Spaces
Podcast: Why Does My Photo Look Different on Instagram?
Real-World Example: The Colors of Cinema: Grading for the Big Screen and Your TV

modules.title: Perception, Analysis, and Advanced Representation
modules.description: This capstone module connects the technical representation of an image to the way we actually perceive it. We'll explore the brain's "auto-correct" features, learn to analyze an image's properties with histograms, and break the limits of standard images with High Dynamic Range (HDR).

lessons.title: Lesson 5: Seeing Like a Human - Perception and Analysis
Podcast: The Brain as a Photoshop Filter
Coding: Plotting Your First Histogram
Lesson 6: Breaking the Limits - High Dynamic Range (HDR)
Podcast: The "HDR Look": From Your Phone to Hollywood
Real-World Example: HDR in Gaming: Seeing into the Shadows
Lesson 7: Chapter 3 Wrap-Up: The Image as Data
Podcast: Chapter 3 Recap: It's All Just Numbers

learningPaths.title: Image Formation: Transformations and Projections
learningPaths.description: This chapter builds a virtual camera from the ground up. We'll explore the mathematical language of 2D and 3D transformations, combine them to model a real camera, and see how this model powers everything from video games to robotic vision.

modules.title: The Language of Geometry
modules.description: Discover the elegant mathematical "hack" that unifies all geometric operations. We'll introduce homogeneous coordinates, the secret language that allows us to describe complex transformations with simple matrix math.

lessons.title: Lesson 1: The Magic of Homogeneous Coordinates
Math Explainer: What ARE Homogeneous Coordinates?

modules.title: The Rigid World
modules.description: Learn to describe how objects move in the world without changing their shape. We'll build the matrices for translation, rotation, and uniform scaling, and experiment with them in an interactive playground.

lessons.title: Lesson 2: The Rigid World: Translation, Rotation, & Scaling
Experiment: The Transformation Playground

modules.title: Bending Reality
modules.description: Move beyond rigid shapes and learn the transformations that bend and warp reality to create perspective. We'll explore the power of Affine and Projective transforms and see them at work in real-world applications like photo stitching and augmented reality.

lessons.title: Lesson 3: Bending Reality: Affine and Projective Transforms
Experiment: The Art of Warping
Example: Transformations in the Wild
Podcast: Talkin' 'Bout Transformations

modules.title: The Camera's Anatomy
modules.description: Dissect a virtual camera into its two key components. We'll define the camera's internal "factory settings" (Intrinsics) and its position and orientation in the world (Extrinsics).

lessons.title: Lesson 4: The Camera's Anatomy: Intrinsics & Extrinsics
Exercise: Transforming 3D Points

modules.title: The Grand Unification
modules.description: Assemble the final, all-powerful Projection Matrix P. In this capstone module, we'll combine intrinsics and extrinsics into a single matrix and use it to project 3D world points into 2D pixel coordinates, both on paper and in code.

lessons.title: Lesson 5: The Full Picture: The Projection Matrix P
Math Explainer: Assembling the Projection Matrix
Coding: Python Projection

modules.title: Graphics vs. Vision
modules.description: Put our complete camera model to work. We'll explore how forward projection (3D to 2D) powers computer graphics and how the reverse problem (2D to 3D) defines the core challenge of 3D computer vision.

lessons.title: Lesson 6: Putting It All to Work
Experiment: The Camera Operator
Podcast: From Pixels to Pose

learningPaths.title: General Fourier Transform
learningPaths.description: This chapter demystifies one of the most powerful tools in engineering and computer science: the Fourier Transform. We will start with the beautiful intuition that complex signals are just recipes of simple sine waves, build the necessary mathematical tools, and finally apply this knowledge to filter and understand digital images.

modules.title: The Core Idea & Intuition
modules.description: Discover the fundamental principle behind all signal processing. We'll see how any complex, repeating signal can be constructed from simple sine waves and develop a non-mathematical intuition for how to find this "frequency recipe."

lessons.title: Lesson 1: The Big Idea - Deconstructing Signals
Podcast: The Symphony of Signals
Visualizing Superposition: Building a Square Wave
Lesson 2: How It Works - The Correlation Intuition
Podcast: The Detective and the Tuning Fork
The Geometry of Correlation

modules.title: The Mathematics & Calculation
modules.description: Level up your mathematical toolkit by exploring the elegance of complex numbers and Euler's formula. We'll see how these tools allow us to formalize our intuition into the concrete equations of the Fourier Series and then get our hands dirty by calculating a signal's recipe step-by-step.

lessons.title: Lesson 3: The Math Toolkit - Complex Oscillations
Podcast: Euler's Jewel
Euler's Formula and the Rotating Vector
Lesson 4: The Real Deal - Fourier Series in Action
Podcast: Getting Your Hands Dirty
Deconstructing the Fourier Series Integral
Exercise: Calculate the Coefficients

modules.title: Application in Computer Vision
modules.description: This capstone module connects the 1D theory to the 2D world of pixels. We'll learn to see images in terms of their "spatial frequencies" and explore how manipulating these frequencies allows for powerful, practical applications like image filtering, sharpening, and compression.

lessons.title: Lesson 5: From Theory to Pixels - The Fourier Transform in CV
Podcast: Seeing with Frequency
The 2D Fourier Transform: From Pixels to Gratings
Case Study: How JPEG Actually Works
Experiment: The Frequency Domain Playground
Coding: Your First FFT - Image Filtering in Python

learningPaths.title: Fourier Transform and Images
learningPaths.description: This chapter takes the concept of signal analysis from one dimension to two. We will discover how to view an image as a collection of "spatial frequencies," learn the mathematics behind the Discrete Cosine Transform (DCT), and deconstruct the JPEG compression algorithm, one of the most important technologies on the internet.

modules.title: Images as Signals
modules.description: This module introduces the fundamental concept of the chapter: an image is not just a grid of pixels, but a 2D spatial signal. We'll build the intuition for "spatial frequency" and see how smooth areas and sharp details correspond to different frequencies.

lessons.title: Lesson 1: From Lines to Pictures - Images as 2D Signals
Podcast 6.1: Pixels, Signals, and Frequencies

modules.title: Deconstructing with the DCT
modules.description: Discover the Discrete Cosine Transform (DCT), the mathematical workhorse behind JPEG. We'll explore its "basis functions"—the building blocks of images—and understand "energy compaction," the key property that makes efficient compression possible.

lessons.title: Lesson 2: The DCT - Our Frequency-Finding Tool
Manim 6.1: What IS the Discrete Cosine Transform?
Podcast 6.2: Deconstructing Images with the DCT

modules.title: Frequency Filtering
modules.description: Now that we can separate frequencies, we can manipulate them. In this module, we'll become "frequency hackers," learning how to create low-pass (blur) and high-pass (edge detection) filters by directly modifying an image's DCT coefficients.

lessons.title: Lesson 3: Hacking Frequencies - Filtering in the DCT Domain
Experiment 6.1: The Frequency Filter Lab
Podcast 6.3: The Frequency DJ

modules.title: The Art of Lossy Compression
modules.description: This module begins our deep dive into the JPEG pipeline. We'll differentiate between lossy and lossless compression and see how JPEG cleverly exploits the quirks of human vision by separating brightness from color information.

lessons.title: Lesson 4: Introducing JPEG - The Art of Losing Information
Example 6.1: The Story of Lena
Podcast 6.4: The Genius of Being Lazy

modules.title: The Heart of the Pipeline
modules.description: We've arrived at the core of JPEG. We'll explore Quantization—the irreversible, lossy step where data is strategically discarded—and the clever Zigzag Scan, an efficiency hack that makes the final compression possible.

lessons.title: Lesson 5: The Heart of JPEG - Quantization & The Zigzag
Manim 6.2: The Math of Quantization
Exercise 6.1: The Quantization Challenge
Coding 6.1: JPEG Steps in Python
Podcast 6.5: The Point of No Return

modules.title: The Final Picture
modules.description: This capstone module examines the consequences of our compression journey by identifying common JPEG "artifacts." We'll then zoom out to review the entire "World to File" process, framing the fundamental challenge for the rest of our course.

lessons.title: Lesson 6: The Aftermath - Artifacts and The Big Picture
Podcast 6.6: The Price of Speed

learningPaths.title: Image Characteristics
learningPaths.description: This chapter transitions from creating images to analyzing them. We'll learn how to distill a complex image into a few simple numbers—its 'character'—and discover why this is the essential first step for preparing images for advanced AI models.

modules.title: Introduction to Image Character
modules.description: Discover why we need to describe images numerically before we can analyze them. We'll explore the core motivations and introduce the concept of standard test images used throughout the field.

lessons.title: Lesson 1: What's the "Character" of an Image?
Podcast: "Pixels with Personality"

modules.title: The Fundamentals - Mean and Variance
modules.description: Get hands-on with the two most fundamental image statistics. We'll learn to calculate the mean to measure brightness and the variance to measure contrast, and see these concepts brought to life with animated explainers.

lessons.title: Lesson 2: Brightness & Contrast - The Mean and Variance
Math Explainer: "Visualizing Mean and Variance"
Exercise: "The Stats Workout"

modules.title: The Full Picture - Histograms and Entropy
modules.description: Go beyond simple averages to understand the full 'fingerprint' of an image. We'll build and interpret histograms, then quantify the image's randomness with the concept of entropy.

lessons.title: Lesson 3: The Image's Fingerprint - Histograms
Coding: "Plot Your First Histogram"
Lesson 4: How Random is Your Image? - Entropy
Math Explainer: "Unpacking Entropy"
Podcast: "Information Overload"

modules.title: Application and Summary
modules.description: Connect theory to practice in this capstone module. We'll see how the concepts we've learned are used to standardize data for real-world AI models and experiment with the dramatic effect this has on performance.

lessons.title: Lesson 5: Prep School for AI - Normalization & Summary
Experiment: "The Preprocessing Playground"
Real-World Example: "Standardization in the Wild: ImageNet"

learningPaths.title: Image Modifications
learningPaths.description: This chapter moves from analyzing images to actively changing them. We'll build a toolkit of fundamental techniques to manipulate pixel values, learning how to enhance images for human eyes, prepare them for algorithms, and normalize them for powerful machine learning models.

modules.title: The Foundations of Modification
modules.description: We begin by answering the fundamental question: "Why modify an image?". This module lays the groundwork by establishing the purpose behind transformations and introducing the core mathematical and computational concepts that all other lessons will build upon.

lessons.title: Lesson 1: Why Bother? An Intro to Image Modifications
Podcast 1: Pixels, Purpose, and Pre-computation

modules.title: Linear Control: Brightness and Contrast
modules.description: Discover the power of straight-line math. We'll deconstruct the classic 'brightness' and 'contrast' sliders, learning how two simple parameters give us direct control over an image's look and feel, and we'll tackle the problem of what to do when our math goes out of bounds.

lessons.title: Lesson 2: Slide and Scale - Mastering Linear Transformations
Manim Explainer 1: The Geometry of Linear Transformations
Exercise 1: Linear Transformation Drills
Podcast 2: The Linear Levers: Brightness vs. Contrast

modules.title: Non-Linear Nuance: Seeing Like a Human
modules.description: Our eyes don't see in straight lines, and neither should our best image modifications. This module introduces Gamma Correction, a sophisticated, non-linear technique that mimics human perception to produce more natural and detailed enhancements.

lessons.title: Lesson 3: Seeing Like a Human - Non-Linear Gamma Correction
Manim Explainer 2: Bending the Curve with Gamma
Example 1: Why Your Photos Look Different on Different Screens
Exercise 2: Gamma Calculation Challenge
Podcast 3: The Gamma Gambit: Why Curves are Better than Lines

modules.title: Data-Driven Enhancements: Histograms
modules.description: Learn to let the image improve itself. We'll explore how an image's own data distribution—its histogram—can be used to automatically and dramatically boost global contrast through the powerful Histogram Equalization algorithm.

lessons.title: Lesson 4: Let the Data Decide - Histogram-Based Enhancements
Manim Explainer 3: The Unfolding of Histogram Equalization
Example 2: From Murky Scans to Clear Views: HE in the Real World
Podcast 4: Letting the Data Drive: The Magic of Histograms

modules.title: Capstone: The Modification Sandbox
modules.description: It's time to apply your new skills. This capstone module brings all the concepts together in a hands-on sandbox and a guided coding session, allowing you to experiment, build, and solidify your understanding of pixel-wise transformations.

lessons.title: Experiment 1: The Image Transformation Sandbox
Coding 1: Image Modifications in Python
Exercise 3: The Histogram Equalization Walkthrough
Lesson 5: Chapter 8 in a Nutshell
Podcast 5: From Pixels to Pictures: A Chapter 8 Retrospective

learningPaths.title: Simple Filters (Kernels)
learningPaths.description: This chapter moves beyond single-pixel analysis to explore the foundational technique of neighborhood operations: convolution. You'll learn how small matrices called kernels can be used to blur, sharpen, and find edges in an image, and discover how this classical technique forms the conceptual bedrock of modern AI vision systems.

modules.title: The Core Concept
modules.description: Discover why looking at a pixel's neighbors is the key to unlocking an image's hidden structure. We'll establish the fundamental difference between pixel-wise and neighborhood operations, setting the stage for all future feature detection.

lessons.title: Lesson 1: From Pixels to People: Why Neighborhoods Matter
Lesson 2: Podcast - "Beyond the Pixel"

modules.title: The Mechanics of Convolution
modules.description: Get hands-on with the 'magic window' of computer vision. We'll break down the convolution operation step-by-step, tackle the practical challenges of image borders and normalization, and solidify the math with animated explainers and exercises.

lessons.title: Lesson 3: The Convolution Operation: Our Magic Window
Lesson 4: Manim Explainer - The Convolution Formula
Lesson 5: Living on the Edge: Borders and Normalization
Lesson 6: Exercise - Convolution by Hand

modules.title: The Filter Toolkit
modules.description: Assemble your digital artist's and detective's toolkit. We'll introduce the specific kernel 'recipes' for classic effects like blurring and sharpening, and then learn to use the powerful Sobel operator to extract an image's most important feature: its edges.

lessons.title: Lesson 7: The Artist's Toolkit: Blur and Sharpen Filters
Lesson 8: The Detective's Toolkit: Finding Edges
Lesson 9: Manim Explainer - Sobel Gradients
Lesson 10: Experiment - The Filter Playground

modules.title: The Bridge to Modern AI
modules.description: This capstone module connects our hand-crafted filters to the world of Artificial Intelligence. You'll understand how the principles you've learned are the foundation for how Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs) learn to 'see' automatically, and you'll implement the convolution algorithm from scratch.

lessons.title: Lesson 11: The Big Picture: From Hand-Crafted to AI-Learned Filters
Lesson 12: Podcast - "The Ghost in the Convolution"
Lesson 13: Coding - Implementing Convolution from Scratch
Lesson 14: Real-World Example - The Unsharp Mask

learningPaths.title: Advanced Kernels: Morphology and Gabor Filters
learningPaths.description: This chapter moves beyond simple linear filters to explore two powerful, non-linear techniques. First, we'll learn how to manipulate object shapes with Morphological Filters to clean up noise and analyze geometry. Then, we'll dive into Gabor Filters to understand how we can describe and detect texture, building a crucial bridge between classical computer vision and the inner workings of modern AI.

modules.title: Morphological Filtering - The Art of Shape
modules.description: Discover how to sculpt digital images. We'll introduce the fundamental operations of Dilation and Erosion to grow and shrink objects, and then combine them into sophisticated tools for removing noise and perfecting shapes.

lessons.title: Lesson 1: The Building Blocks of Shape - Dilation & Erosion
Math Explainer: The Rank-Order Operations
Podcast: The Shape Shifters' Roundtable

modules.title: Advanced Image Cleaning
modules.description: Learn how to combine basic morphological tools for advanced image cleaning. We'll master Opening and Closing to precisely remove "salt" and "pepper" noise, and see how the Median Filter offers a robust alternative.

lessons.title: Lesson 2: Advanced Cleaning - Opening, Closing, & Median Filter
Experiment: Image Cleaning Playground
Real-World Example: From Blood Cells to Barcodes: Where Morphology Matters

modules.title: Gabor Filters - The Language of Texture
modules.description: Shift focus from shape to texture. We'll deconstruct the Gabor filter to understand how it mimics the human visual system by combining a wave and a window to detect patterns at specific orientations and scales.

lessons.title: Lesson 3: Analyzing Texture - Introducing Gabor Filters
Math Explainer: The Gabor Filter Formula
Experiment: Gabor Filter Texture Inspector

modules.title: From Filter Banks to Artificial Intelligence
modules.description: Assemble a "team" of Gabor filters into a Filter Bank to perform comprehensive texture analysis. This capstone module reveals the profound connection between this classical technique and the automatically learned features in modern Convolutional Neural Networks.

lessons.title: Lesson 4: Gabor Filters in Action - Filter Banks & The Link to AI
Coding: Coding a Gabor Filter Bank
Podcast: The Texture Analysts' Debrief

learningPaths.title: Convolutional Neural Networks
learningPaths.description: This chapter moves from manual filters to the revolutionary architecture that allows machines to learn to see. We will deconstruct the Convolutional Neural Network (CNN), explore its mathematical engine, and discover how this powerful tool learns to recognize objects, building a bridge between raw pixels and intelligent perception.

modules.title: The Problem & The Principles
modules.description: Discover why traditional neural networks fail spectacularly when faced with images. We will then unveil the three elegant, biologically-inspired principles that form the foundation of every modern computer vision model.

lessons.title: Lesson 1: The Problem with Pictures: Why Regular Neural Networks Fail
Exercise: The Parameter Problem
Lesson 2: The CNN Solution: Local Vision & Shared Knowledge
Podcast: Why Your Brain is a CNN

modules.title: The Mechanics of a CNN
modules.description: Go under the hood to understand the computational engine of a CNN. Through animated explainers and hands-on experiments, we'll master the core operations of convolution and pooling that turn images into feature maps.

lessons.title: Lesson 3: Under the Hood: The Math of Convolutions & Pooling
Manim Video: The Convolution Operation
Experiment: The Convolution Playground
Coding: Building a Convolutional Layer from Scratch

modules.title: The Big Picture & Real-World Application
modules.description: This capstone module reveals what a CNN truly learns by visualizing its internal filters. We'll celebrate its power by revisiting the story of AlexNet, the network that ignited the deep learning revolution, and end with a critical look at how these models can fail by learning the wrong lessons.

lessons.title: Lesson 4: The Payoff: Seeing What a CNN Learns (And When It Fails)
Example: AlexNet: The Network That Started a Revolution
Podcast: My CNN Thinks My Dog is an Airplane

learningPaths.title: Classification with Deep Learning: The AlexNet Revolution
learningPaths.description: This chapter marks a pivotal moment in AI history. We'll travel back to 2012 to dissect the AlexNet model, a deep neural network that shattered all previous records in image recognition and single-handedly launched the modern deep learning era. Through a mix of theory, hands-on experiments, and coding exercises, you will understand not just how this model worked, but why it changed the world.

modules.title: The Paradigm Shift
modules.description: We set the stage by exploring the state of computer vision before 2012, characterized by slow, incremental progress. We will then witness the "earthquake" moment when AlexNet arrived, quantifying its staggering leap in performance and understanding its immediate impact on the field.

lessons.title: Real-World Example: The Dawn of a New Era: Why AlexNet Matters
Lesson 1: The Revolution Begins
Podcast: The Day Vision Changed

modules.title: The Fuel for the Revolution
modules.description: A model is nothing without its fuel. Here, we dive into the massive ImageNet dataset that powered AlexNet. You will learn the crucial preprocessing steps and the clever data augmentation techniques used to prevent the model from simply memorizing data, a concept you will then apply yourself in a hands-on lab and your first PyTorch coding exercise.

lessons.title: Lesson 2: The Fuel - ImageNet & Data Augmentation
Hands-On: The Data Augmentation Lab
Coding: Your First Image Transformations in PyTorch
Podcast: More Data Than You Have

modules.title: The Architectural Blueprint
modules.description: Let's look under the hood. In this module, we dissect the 8-layer architecture of AlexNet, piece by piece. We will explore its key innovations, like the game-changing ReLU activation function, and understand the engineering feats required to make it work on the hardware of the time. You will then get to build these components in code.

lessons.title: Lesson 3: The Blueprint - AlexNet's Architecture
Math Explainer: The Power of ReLU
Exercise: The Feature Map Calculator
Coding: Building Blocks: Your First CNN Layers in PyTorch
Podcast: Blueprints for a Beast

modules.title: Taming the Beast
modules.description: With 60 million parameters, AlexNet was a powerful but wild beast, prone to overfitting. This module covers the art of training and regularization. You will learn about the crucial Dropout technique and then apply it yourself in an interactive playground and a coding exercise to see its dramatic effect on taming an overconfident model.

lessons.title: Lesson 4: Taming the Beast - Training & Regularization
Hands-On: The Dropout Playground
Coding: Taming Overfitting: Adding Dropout to a Model
Podcast: Don't Memorize, Generalize!

modules.title: The Lasting Legacy
modules.description: This capstone module explores what AlexNet actually learned and why it remains so important today. We will see how its learned features mirror our own visual system and demystify "Transfer Learning," one of the most powerful techniques in modern AI. You will conclude the chapter by applying this concept in a final capstone project: fine-tuning a pre-trained network to solve a new problem.

lessons.title: Lesson 5: The Legacy - Results & Transfer Learning
Real-World Example: Classifying Flowers with Transfer Learning
Coding: Capstone Project: Fine-Tuning a Pre-trained Network
Podcast: Standing on the Shoulders of Giants

learningPaths.title: The Evolution of CNN Architectures for Classification
learningPaths.description: This chapter traces the historical "race to go deeper" in neural network design. From the foundational models to the hyper-efficient architectures of today, we will uncover the recurring pattern of innovation where each breakthrough solves a problem created by the last, ultimately leading to the powerful models that define modern AI.

modules.title: Foundations and Preprocessing
modules.description: Before we build, we must prepare. This module covers the essential, non-negotiable data preparation steps that are the foundation of any successful deep learning model. We'll learn why data needs to be the right size, scale, and variety.

lessons.title: Lesson 1: Preparing for the Deep Dive: Data Preprocessing
Lesson 1.1: The Math of Standardization
Lesson 1.2: The Preprocessing Pipeline
Lesson 1.3: Preprocessing in the Wild

modules.title: The First Breakthroughs
modules.description: Travel back in time to witness the two pivotal moments that started it all. We'll meet the "grandparent" architecture that laid the blueprint and the "Big Bang" model that ignited the deep learning revolution.

lessons.title: Lesson 2: The Foundation and the Breakthrough: LeNet & AlexNet
Lesson 2.1: The Unsung Hero: The Story of ImageNet

modules.title: The Race for Depth and Efficiency
modules.description: With the revolution underway, two competing philosophies emerged. We'll explore VGGNet's elegant but brute-force approach to depth and GoogLeNet's clever, wider design that prioritized computational efficiency.

lessons.title: Lesson 3: VGGNet: The Power of Simple, Deep Design
Lesson 3.1: Receptive Field Arithmetic
Lesson 4: GoogLeNet & Inception: Thinking Wider, Not Just Deeper
Lesson 4.1: The Bottleneck Calculation
Lesson 4.2: VGG vs. Inception

modules.title: The Modern Era of Deep Learning
modules.description: As networks grew incredibly deep, new challenges arose. This module covers the brilliant "shortcut" that solved the degradation problem and the subsequent shift towards smarter design principles like attention and optimal scaling.

lessons.title: Lesson 5: ResNet: Solving the Degradation Problem with a 'Shortcut'
Lesson 5.1: The Residual Connection in Code
Lesson 6: The Modern Era: Efficiency and Attention
Lesson 6.1: The Architecture Playground
Lesson 6.2: Attention is All You (Really) Need?

modules.title: Synthesis and Conclusion
modules.description: This capstone module brings our entire historical journey together. We will visualize the full timeline of innovation and, most importantly, understand how these powerful classification models serve as the "backbone" for nearly all modern computer vision tasks.

lessons.title: Lesson 7: Summary: The Journey and The Timeline

learningPaths.title: Attention and its Application to Images
learningPaths.description: This chapter introduces the revolutionary attention mechanism, a concept that fundamentally changed deep learning. We'll explore why traditional models struggle with 'long-term memory' and then build the attention mechanism from the ground up, moving from an intuitive analogy to its powerful mathematical engine. Finally, we'll see how this new paradigm challenges the reign of convolutions in computer vision.

modules.title: Understanding the Problem
modules.description: Discover the hidden limitations of our most powerful vision and language models. We'll explore why CNNs have 'tunnel vision' and why RNNs are 'forgetful', setting the stage for a new kind of solution.

lessons.title: Lesson 1: The "Memory Problem" in Neural Networks
Hands-On: The RNN Bottleneck Playground
Real-World Example: When Long-Term Memory Matters in Machine Translation
Podcast: The Forgetful Robot

modules.title: The Core Idea of Attention
modules.description: Learn the beautiful and intuitive analogy at the heart of the attention mechanism. Through a 'database retrieval' model, we'll demystify how a system can dynamically decide what information is most relevant.

lessons.title: Lesson 2: Attention 101: The Database Analogy
Hands-On: The Q, K, V Game
Podcast: The Library of a Mind

modules.title: The Mathematics of Attention
modules.description: Go 'under the hood' to translate the Query, Key, and Value analogy into concrete mathematics. We'll build the attention formula step-by-step and implement it ourselves to solidify our understanding.

lessons.title: Lesson 3: Under the Hood: The Math of Self-Attention
Math Explainer: Visualizing the Attention Formula
Exercise: Calculate Attention by Hand
Coding Lab: A Bare-Bones Attention Mechanism in NumPy
Podcast: The Elegant Engine

modules.title: Assembling the Transformer
modules.description: Move from a single mechanism to a complete, stackable deep learning unit. We'll add crucial components like Positional Encoding and Multi-Head Attention to construct a full Transformer Block.

lessons.title: Lesson 4: Building a Transformer: Putting the Pieces Together
Math Explainer: Multi-Head Attention & Positional Encoding
Coding Lab: Building a Transformer Block in PyTorch
Podcast: More Heads are Better Than One

modules.title: The Bigger Picture
modules.description: Witness the grand showdown between Attention and Convolution. We'll compare their fundamental philosophies and explore the critical trade-offs that define the modern landscape of computer vision.

lessons.title: Lesson 5: The Grand Showdown: Attention vs. Convolution
Hands-On: The Inductive Bias Playground
Real-World Example: The Vision Transformer (ViT) and the Data-Hungry Beast
Podcast: The Battle for Vision

learningPaths.title: Vision Transformer
learningPaths.description: This chapter dives into the revolutionary Transformer architecture. We'll start with its origins in natural language processing and then explore how it was brilliantly adapted for computer vision, first with the groundbreaking Vision Transformer (ViT) and then refined with the efficient and powerful Swin Transformer.

modules.title: The Original Transformer Architecture
modules.description: We begin by dissecting the model that changed NLP forever. You'll learn the roles of the Encoder and Decoder, and understand the core mechanism of Self-Attention that allows a model to weigh the importance of different words in a sentence.

lessons.title: Lesson 1: The Original Transformer - A Language Masterpiece
Manim Video: The Mechanics of Self-Attention
Coding: Attention from Scratch
Podcast: "Attention Is All You Need"

modules.title: The Vision Challenge
modules.description: Discover the fundamental barrier to applying Transformers to images. We'll do the math to understand the O(D⁴) computational explosion and explore the incredible prize that motivated researchers to solve it: the global receptive field.

lessons.title: Lesson 2: The Challenge & The Prize: Attention in the Pixel World
Manim Video: Why Pixels Break Transformers: The O(D⁴) Explosion
Exercise: The Cost of Attention
Podcast: The Billion-Dollar Problem

modules.title: The Vision Transformer (ViT)
modules.description: Meet the first pure-Transformer architecture to achieve state-of-the-art results on image classification. We'll break down its clever strategy of turning images into sequences of patches and analyze its "data-hungry" nature.

lessons.title: Lesson 3: The Vision Transformer (ViT) - A New Hope
Example: ViT in the Wild: Powering Your Photo Search
Experiment: The Vision Transformer Playground
Coding: Using a Pre-trained ViT
Podcast: The "Big Bet" on Data

modules.title: The Swin Transformer
modules.description: Explore the evolution of ViT. The Swin Transformer re-introduces the wisdom of CNNs—locality and hierarchy—to create a model that is both more efficient and more versatile, thanks to its brilliant shifted-window attention mechanism.

lessons.title: Lesson 4: Swin Transformer - Bringing Back Hierarchy
Manim Video: The Swin Transformer's Shifted Window Trick
Exercise: Swin-onomics
Podcast: The Wisdom of the Ancients

modules.title: The Modern Vision Toolkit
modules.description: This capstone module synthesizes the chapter's content into a practical framework. We'll compare the pros and cons of CNNs, ViT, and Swin, helping you understand how to choose the right architectural tool for any given vision task.

lessons.title: Lesson 5: Conclusion - The Modern Vision Toolkit
Example: Fusing Worlds: Transformers and CNNs in Autonomous Driving
Podcast: The Architect's Dilemma

learningPaths.title: Object Detection Fundamentals
learningPaths.description: This chapter moves from simple image classification to the more complex and practical task of object detection. We'll define the core problem, master the metrics used to evaluate performance, and trace the evolution of the pioneering R-CNN family of detectors, laying the groundwork for all modern object detection systems.

modules.title: The Core Challenge of Detection
modules.description: Learn why finding objects is much harder than just naming an image. We'll define the dual challenges of localization and handling a variable number of outputs, establishing why object detection is a combined classification and regression task.

lessons.title: Lesson 1: From "What?" to "Where?": The Challenge of Object Detection
Podcast 1.1: The Daily Detection
Real-World Example 1.2: The Barcode Scanner and the Birth of Localization

modules.title: Evaluating Localization
modules.description: Discover how we mathematically score a model's ability to draw a good box. We'll master the fundamental metric of Intersection over Union (IoU) and learn how to use it to decide if a prediction is a "hit" or a "miss".

lessons.title: Lesson 2: Are We Close? Evaluating Localization with IoU
Math Explainer 2.1: Visualizing Intersection over Union
Exercise 2.2: IoU Calculation Practice
Podcast 2.3: How Close is Close Enough?

modules.title: The Ultimate Scorecard
modules.description: Go beyond single predictions to evaluate the entire model. We'll explore the trade-off between Precision and Recall, build the P-R curve, and master the industry-standard metrics of Average Precision (AP) and mean Average Precision (mAP).

lessons.title: Lesson 3: The Ultimate Scorecard: Average Precision (AP) and mAP
Math Explainer 3.1: The Story of the Precision-Recall Curve
Hands-On 3.2: The Precision-Recall Playground
Podcast 3.3: The One Metric to Rule Them All

modules.title: The R-CNN Pioneer
modules.description: Travel back to 2014 to meet R-CNN, the complex but revolutionary model that started it all. We will dissect its multi-stage "propose-then-classify" pipeline and understand its critical performance bottlenecks.

lessons.title: Lesson 4: The Pioneer: R-CNN and its Pipeline
Coding 4.1: Implementing Non-Maximum Suppression (NMS)
Real-World Example 4.2: The AlexNet Revolution
Podcast 4.3: The Frankenstein's Monster of Vision

modules.title: The Fast R-CNN Revolution
modules.description: Witness how two elegant innovations—shared computation and multi-task learning—transformed the clunky R-CNN into the dramatically faster and more elegant Fast R-CNN, setting the stage for all modern detectors.

lessons.title: Lesson 5: Faster, Smarter, Better: The Fast R-CNN Revolution
Math Explainer 5.1: The Elegance of RoI Pooling
Hands-On 5.2: The Multi-Task Loss Balancer
Podcast 5.3: The Final Bottleneck

learningPaths.title: Object Detection II: Single-Shot and Transformer-Based Approaches
learningPaths.description: This chapter moves beyond foundational detectors to explore the revolutionary architectures that enabled real-time performance and true end-to-end learning. We will dissect the innovations of Faster R-CNN, the paradigm-shifting speed of YOLO, and the architectural elegance of the vision Transformer (DETR).

modules.title: The End-to-End Revolution
modules.description: Discover the crucial innovation that integrated region proposals directly into the neural network. We'll explore the Region Proposal Network (RPN) and the concept of anchor boxes, which turned two-stage detectors into unified, end-to-end trainable systems.

lessons.title: Lesson 1: From Manual to Learned: The Faster R-CNN Revolution
Experiment: The Anchor Box Playground
Podcast: The Detective and the Assistant

modules.title: You Only Look Once
modules.description: Witness a fundamental paradigm shift with the YOLO architecture. We'll learn how reframing detection as a single regression problem unlocked real-time speed and how the grid system and confidence score work together to make it possible.

lessons.title: Lesson 2: YOLO - A New Paradigm
Manim Video Explainer: Visualizing the YOLO Confidence Score
Exercise: Decoding the YOLO Tensor
Code-Along: From YOLO Output to Final Detections
Podcast: One Look is All You Need

modules.title: Conquering Scale
modules.description: Address the fundamental challenge of detecting objects at vastly different scales. We will dissect the Feature Pyramid Network (FPN), a powerful and standard architectural pattern that gives models robust multi-scale vision by combining deep semantics with shallow details.

lessons.title: Lesson 3: Seeing Big and Small: Feature Pyramid Networks
Real-World Impact: How FPNs Help Doctors Find Tumors
Experiment: The FPN Visualizer
Podcast: The View from the Pyramid

modules.title: The Transformer Arrives
modules.description: Explore the latest frontier in object detection with DETR. Learn how borrowing the Transformer architecture from NLP allows us to create an elegant detector that discards hand-crafted components like anchor boxes and NMS by treating detection as a direct set prediction problem.

lessons.title: Lesson 4: The Final Frontier? DETR and the Transformer
Manim Video Explainer: The Assignment Problem: How DETR Finds Its Pairs
Podcast: The Great Unification

learningPaths.title: Semantic Segmentation: A Pixel-Level Understanding
learningPaths.description: This chapter moves beyond simple classification to the most detailed form of scene understanding. We'll learn how machines can be taught to label every single pixel in an image, a critical skill for robotics, medical imaging, and autonomous systems.

modules.title: Foundations of Semantic Segmentation
modules.description: Learn what semantic segmentation is and why it's so powerful. We'll differentiate it from other vision tasks, understand its real-world impact, and then learn how to properly measure a model's performance with the industry-standard IoU metric.

lessons.title: Lesson 1: Pixel-Perfect Vision: What is Semantic Segmentation?
Lesson 1.1: The Segmentation Conversation
Lesson 2: Measuring What Matters: Intersection over Union (IoU)
Lesson 2.1: The IoU Metric, Visualized
Lesson 2.2: The Segmentation Scorecard
Lesson 2.3: Why Metrics Matter

modules.title: Foundational Architectures
modules.description: Discover the elegant blueprint that powers nearly all modern segmentation models. We'll explore the encoder-decoder paradigm, the pioneering Fully Convolutional Network (FCN), and the "upsampling engine" that makes reconstruction possible.

lessons.title: Lesson 3: The Blueprint: Encoder-Decoders & The FCN
Lesson 3.1: The 'Aha!' Moment of FCN
Lesson 3.2: The Skip Connection Playground
Lesson 4: The Upsampling Engine: Transposed Convolutions
Lesson 4.1: The Truth About 'Deconvolution'
Lesson 4.2: Learnable vs. Fixed

modules.title: Modern Architectures and Advanced Methods
modules.description: Go from the blueprint to the masterpiece. We'll dissect the famous U-Net architecture and then implement a mini-version ourselves. Finally, we'll explore advanced techniques that solve the lingering challenges of context and boundary refinement.

lessons.title: Lesson 5: The Masterpiece: U-Net's Symmetrical Power
Lesson 5.1: The Elegance of the 'U'
Lesson 5.2: Coding Lab: Building a Mini U-Net in PyTorch
Lesson 6: Pushing the Limits: Advanced Segmentation Techniques
Lesson 6.1: The Pro-Gamer Moves
Lesson 6.2: Advanced Techniques Sandbox
Lesson 6.3: Case Study: The Eyes of a Self-Driving Car

learningPaths.title: Advanced Image Segmentation: Instances and Foundation Models
learningPaths.description: This chapter moves beyond basic segmentation to explore the cutting-edge techniques that allow machines to distinguish between individual objects and understand scenes with near-human nuance. We'll journey from refining contextual awareness in CNNs to interacting with massive, promptable foundation models that are redefining what's possible in computer vision.

modules.title: Mastering Multi-Scale Context
modules.description: Learn how the DeepLab family of models solved the critical challenge of seeing both the "forest" and the "trees." We'll explore the elegant trick of atrous convolution and see how the ASPP module enables a model to analyze an image at multiple scales simultaneously.

lessons.title: Lesson 1: Mastering Context with DeepLab
Podcast: Why Bigger Isn't Always Better
Math Explainer: Visualizing Atrous Convolution
Exercise: The Receptive Field Challenge
Coding: Putting DeepLab to the Test

modules.title: A Spectrum of Understanding
modules.description: Discover that "segmentation" is not a single task but a spectrum of understanding. We will clearly define and differentiate between semantic, instance, and panoptic segmentation, establishing the "what," the "which," and the "everything" of scene parsing.

lessons.title: Lesson 2: Beyond Pixels: Instance & Panoptic Segmentation
Podcast: Things, Stuff, and Robot Vacuums
Real-World Example: How Augmented Reality Apps Understand Your Room
Hands-On: The Segmentation Sorter

modules.title: The Architecture of Precision
modules.description: Dissect the influential Mask R-CNN architecture to understand how it performs instance segmentation. We will uncover the "secret sauce" of RoIAlign and see how maintaining perfect spatial alignment is the key to generating pixel-perfect masks.

lessons.title: Lesson 3: The "How": Mask R-CNN and RoIAlign
Podcast: The Case of the Blurry Masks
Math Explainer: The Precision of RoIAlign
Coding: Becoming a Mask R-CNN Detective

modules.title: The Modern Era and the Rise of Generalists
modules.description: This capstone module launches us to the current frontier of AI. We'll meet hybrid Transformer models, automated frameworks that build models for us, and the game-changing Segment Anything Model (SAM), a foundation model you can interact with directly.

lessons.title: Lesson 4: The Modern Era: Foundation Models & Automation
Podcast: One Model to Rule Them All?
Real-World Example: The Epic Story of SA-1B
Coding: Prompting the Future: Your First Interaction with SAM

learningPaths.title: Human Pose Estimation: From Heatmap Regression to Part Affinity Fields
learningPaths.description: This chapter unpacks the fascinating world of Human Pose Estimation (HPE). We'll journey from the fundamental challenges of the task to the brilliant architectural solutions that power modern systems, exploring how computers learn to see and understand the articulated structure of the human body.

modules.title: The Core Problem & Grand Strategies
modules.description: Learn the what, why, and how of Human Pose Estimation. We'll define the core task, explore its real-world challenges, and contrast the two major strategies—Top-Down and Bottom-Up—that form the foundation of all modern approaches.

lessons.title: Lesson 1: What in the World is Human Pose Estimation?
Case Study: Hawk-Eye in Sports
Playground: The Strategist's Choice
Podcast 1: The Lay of the Land

modules.title: The Heatmap Paradigm
modules.description: Discover the conceptual breakthrough that revolutionized pose estimation. We'll move beyond simple coordinate prediction to the robust paradigm of heatmap regression and explore the elegant mathematics of 2D Gaussians that make it all work.

lessons.title: Lesson 2: The Heatmap Paradigm: Painting with Probabilities
Math Explainer: The 2D Gaussian Function
Exercise: Heatmap Calculations
Coding Lab 1: Generating a Heatmap
Podcast 2: The 'Aha!' Moment

modules.title: Top-Down Architectures in Detail
modules.description: Take a deep dive into the architectures of two legendary Top-Down models. We'll dissect the multi-stage refinement of CPM and the symmetrical, multi-scale fusion of Stacked Hourglass to understand how to build networks that see both the forest and the trees.

lessons.title: Lesson 3: Masters of Context: Top-Down Architectures
Case Study: The U-Net Connection
Playground: The Architect's Toolbox
Podcast 3: Architectural Trade-offs

modules.title: The Bottom-Up Revolution
modules.description: Explore the elegant solution to tracking poses in crowded scenes with OpenPose. We'll tackle the difficult 'association problem' and learn how the ingenious invention of Part Affinity Fields (PAFs) allows a network to connect all the right dots.

lessons.title: Lesson 4: OpenPose and the Art of Association
Math Explainer: The Line Integral for PAFs
Exercise: PAF Connection Scoring
Coding Lab 2: The Association Scorer
Podcast 4: The Genius of the Vector Field

modules.title: From Skeletons to Solutions
modules.description: This capstone module connects theory to practice. We'll see how HPE serves as a powerful building block for higher-level AI tasks, recap our entire journey, and implement a mini-project to analyze motion from a video.

lessons.title: Lesson 5: From Skeletons to Solutions: Applications & Recap
Case Study: Pose-Based Action Recognition
Coding Lab 3: Putting It All Together
Podcast 5: The Future is Articulated

learningPaths.title: Generative Adversarial Networks
learningPaths.description: This chapter ventures into the "creative universe" of deep learning. We will dissect the ingenious adversarial framework of Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs), learning how two competing networks can be trained to generate stunningly realistic images from nothing but random noise. We'll explore the theory, master the training, and discover the common pitfalls and advanced techniques that revolutionized generative AI.

modules.title: The Foundation of Generative Art
modules.description: Before we build an AI artist, we must first learn how to be an art critic. This module introduces the core concept of generative modeling and explores the crucial metrics, Inception Score (IS) and Fréchet Inception Distance (FID), that allow us to objectively score the quality and diversity of AI-generated art.

lessons.title: Lesson 1: What Are We Building and How Do We Judge It?
Manim Video: Visualizing Evaluation Metrics
Podcast: The Critic and The Creator

modules.title: The Adversarial Game
modules.description: Discover the elegant "cat-and-mouse" game at the heart of GANs. We'll meet the two key players—the Generator and the Discriminator—and break down the minimax objective function that pits them against each other in a duel that drives both to perfection.

lessons.title: Lesson 2: The GAN Framework: A Two-Player Game
Manim Video: The Minimax Game
Example Lesson: The Faces That Never Were
Podcast: The Art of the Rivalry

modules.title: The Reality of Training
modules.description: Step into the role of the trainer and learn the delicate, alternating dance of GAN training. We'll explore why this process is notoriously unstable and then get hands-on experience in the "GAN Playground" to witness and diagnose common pitfalls like mode collapse and vanishing gradients.

lessons.title: Lesson 3: Training GANs and Common Pitfalls
Experiment Lesson: The GAN Playground
Podcast: Why Is This So Hard?

modules.title: Gaining Control and Power
modules.description: Move beyond random generation to directed creation. This module introduces advanced architectures that give us control over the GAN's output. We'll explore Conditional GANs for specific requests and the magic of CycleGAN, which can translate between image domains—like horses to zebras—without any paired data.

lessons.title: Lesson 4: Leveling Up: Conditional GANs and Image Translation
Coding Lesson: Your First Conditional GAN
Podcast: The Creative Explosion

modules.title: The Big Picture and Beyond
modules.description: This capstone module places GANs in the broader context of modern AI. We'll look at the current state-of-the-art with Diffusion Models and reflect on the profound and lasting legacy of the adversarial idea, solidifying your understanding of the generative AI landscape.

lessons.title: Lesson 5: Beyond GANs and The Big Picture
Example Lesson: The Rise of the Diffusion Models
Podcast: The Shoulders of Giants
